bill_title: clarify certain provisions regarding the use of a vehicle at certain intersections.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify certain provisions regarding the use of a vehicle on a state highway. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-26-2 be amended to read as follows: 32-26-2. In crossing an intersection of highways or the intersection of a highway by a railroad right-of-way, the driver of a vehicle shall at all times cause such vehicle to travel on the right half of the highway unless such right half is obstructed or impassable. However, this section does not apply to a vehicle passing another vehicle on a state highway at an intersection of the state highway with a county highway, county secondary road, or a township road unless the intersection is marked as a no-passing zone. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 32-26-36 be amended to read as follows: 32-26-36. No vehicle may be driven on the left side of the roadway when approaching within one hundred feet of or traversing any intersection or railroad grade crossing or when the view is obstructed upon approaching within one hundred feet of any bridge, viaduct, or tunnel. However, this section does not apply to a vehicle passing another vehicle on a state highway at an intersection of the state highway with a county highway, county secondary road, or a township road unless the intersection is marked as a no-passing zone. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify certain provisions regarding the use of a vehicle at certain intersections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-26-2 be amended to read as follows: 32-26-2. In crossing an intersection of highways or the intersection of a highway by a railroad right-of-way, the driver of a vehicle shall at all times cause such vehicle to travel on the right half of the highway unless such right half is obstructed or impassable. However, this section does not apply to a vehicle passing another vehicle at an intersection of a state highway with a township road or improved section line unless the intersection is marked as a no-passing zone. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 450 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
